title-group.article-title: Gable-Ends and Che Guevara: Political Murals and Postcolonial Ethics

Jeffrey A. Sluka argues: 'The new wave of Loyalist murals is much more present-oriented; the focus is on paramilitary organizations — their armed actions, "martyrs" and prisoners — and on the symbols of local community identity such as marching bands' ('The Writ¬ ing's on the Wall: Peace Process Images, Symbols and Murals in Northern Ireland', Critique of Anthropology 16:4 (1996), 385).
